verbose_text: Paumen et al demonstrated that saturated fatty acids (e.g., palmitoleic acid, signal at 2.02 ppm in our study) induced the de novo synthesis of ceramide and programmed cell death; they suggested that the inhibition of carnitine palmitoyl transferase I activity induced both sphingolipid synthesis and palmitate induced cell death.
evidence: et al demonstrated that saturated fatty acids (e.g., palmitoleic acid, signal at 2.02 ppm in our study) induced the de novo synthesis of ceramide
